definition: adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
lit. the emperor's daughter does not worry about whether she will be able to marry (idiom)/fig. highly sought after
pinyin: huang2 di4 nu:3 er2 bu4 chou2 jia4

definition: see 黃花閨女|黄花闺女[huang2 hua1 gui1 nu:3]

sentences.english: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Sarah.
Yang Lei's mother supported her daughter's decision.
sentences.chinese: 楊雷的媽媽支持她女兒的選擇。

sentences.english: That apparently made quite an impression on the president's young daughter.
sentences.chinese: 着很顯然給總統的小女兒留下了很深的印象。

sentences.english: Obama's daughters are not to get "swine flu" jabs because of risk.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬的女兒們基於風險，不要豬流感刺戳。

sentences.english: And the children of Amram； Aaron， and Moses， and Miriam.
sentences.chinese: 暗蘭的兒子是亞倫，摩西，還有女兒米利暗。
我的女兒瑪瑞娜和勞倫又會如何呢？

sentences.english: After pulling off the shell, she observed the hard-boiled egg inside.
sentences.chinese: 當女兒敲碎蛋殼發現裏面已經是被煮得很硬的蛋白。

sentences.english: The police are also urging him to have his daughter's body cremated quickly, he said.
sentences.chinese: 警察還極力敦促他儘快將女兒的遺體火化，陳廣乾說。

sentences.english: Rhett bought his daughter a pony to ride on.
sentences.chinese: 瑞德給他的女兒買了一匹小馬來騎。

sentences.english: Woman is the daughter of rich family, literature, everything terrible.
sentences.chinese: 女人是大戶人家的女兒，琴棋書畫樣樣了得。

sentences.english: DA 's dad: (Shaking KS's hand and whispering) Take good care of her.
sentences.chinese: 丹父和江石握手把女兒交託給他。

sentences.english: No longer would his darling’s candle be extinguished by his useless tears.
sentences.chinese: 寶貝女兒的蠟燭再也沒有被他無用的眼淚熄滅過。

sentences.english: I am a divorced and have a teenaged daughter.
sentences.chinese: 我離異，有一個十幾歲的女兒。

sentences.english: Marie-Thérèse was also the mother of his son Claude, and his daughter Paloma.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗後來又生了兒子克勞德和女兒帕露瑪。

sentences.english: So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim;
sentences.chinese: 於是，何西阿去娶了滴拉音的女兒歌篾。

sentences.english: They tell you about their daughter and what she is doing.
sentences.chinese: 他們跟你談論自己的女兒，告訴你她現在從事的工作。

definition: daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman

Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
